item.title: get rid of heavy pyls in vim-lsp
item.description: # vim-lsp and pyls I tried switching Vim’s Python input completion from jedi-vim to vim-lsp, but the operation is heavy. And after a while after editing a Python file, there are frequent automatic downloads of .py files on OneDrive that have nothing to do with the file you’re editing. Looking at the process, pylint was a sub process of pyls.exe and it was running with CPU full open and eating up memory.
